Zinzy Waleson

  • Designer & facilitator
  • East side of Amsterdam
  • Available on email, IndieWeb, LinkedIn, and Github

Hey pal, I’m Zinzy (she/they). I build digital products and resonant queer spaces. I live in Amsterdam’s finest neighborhood with my dynamite partner.

I’m glad you made it to my corner of the Internet. I come here to link and think. This space contains a changelog with casual updates, as well as a collection of loosely-related notes and things I watch, read, and listen to. A good place to start is my now page.

Changelog

  • May 11, 2022 20:15
    Liked Look at this fucking writer: Roxane Gay
  • May 3, 2022 08:12
    Replied to My IndieWebCamp experience

    Great work on setting up your first personal website, Deborah, and welcome to the IndieWeb! Watching my personal Internet heroes help you wade into the waters of independent web publishing was so refreshing for me. Not all corners of the Internet are welcoming to new faces, but I hope you had as great a time as I had at our first IndieWebCamp!

  • May 1, 2022 08:30
    Liked Tollwerk Farbsystem
  • April 30, 2022 00:00
    RSVP'd yes to Homebrew Website Club Europe

    RSVP’d to my first-ever Homebrew get-together on May 4th. I’m curious to see who will be there, and a tad nervous about not being dorky enough. A while ago I made the distinction between Anja and myself by saying she’s a full-on dork, and I’m a dork with a hint of cool because I’m in IT, and then she rolled her eyes at me by using her eyes and, really, her entire head.

  • April 20, 2022 19:21
    Replied to Radiolab episode 'NULL'

    One of the most endearing aspects of working with engineers is the disappointment in their faces every time they learn that a problem was produced by their own typo. I can’t imagine how the person responsible for the typo at the DMV must feel.

  • April 16, 2022 22:34
    Replied to IndieWeb browsing

    Much like you, I very much enjoy browsing the IndieWeb using Indieweb webrings. When I stumbled upon your post, and saw my website listed as one of your new finds, my heart skipped a beat. Since I don’t make an effort to be found on the Internet, I forget people ever even find my website. I imagine this is what it must feel like to make contact again with another human after an apocalypse, divided by 1,000.

  • April 16, 2022 00:00

    Today, during my Saturday morning coffee run, I bumped into a Dutch-Sri Lankan acquaintance. My favorite barista took one look at us and said “are you sisters?” She then got embarrassed and immediately went on a lunch break. It was refreshing to experience such an event in the presence of another person of color.

  • April 15, 2022 20:38
    Liked Neske Beks: 'Sommige woorden zijn aan mijn schors blijven plakken'
  • April 13, 2022 09:29
    Liked Hoe je je aandacht terugverovert op de internetvampiers

    Replied to The New York Dream of Cheap Rent and No Roommates? It’s Over.

    I feel sorry for everyone who’s in an unstable rental situation. These pictures remind me of Sannah Kvist’s All I Own.

  • April 9, 2020 08:13

    I was invited to share my experience as a queer Catholic Afropean on Vine & Fig’s podcast Tabard Inn. Listen to the episode.

Zinzy Waleson is a designer and facilitator from Amsterdam. This personal site is part of the IndieWeb. You may reach her via email, LinkedIn, and Github.
